Plot QTL data

Source: R/ggbio.R
GGBIO.QTL_track.Rd

Plot QTL data

GGBIO.QTL_track(
  gr.snp,
  QTL_prefix = "QTL",
  labels_subset = c("Lead SNP", "Credible Set", "Consensus SNP"),
  color_r2 = T,
  show.legend = T,
  PP_threshold = 0.95,
  sig_cutoff = 5e-08
)

Arguments

gr.snp

echolocator fine-mapping results in GRanges format.
labels_subset

Which SNP groups to label.
show.legend

Whether to show legend.
PP_threshold

The minimum fine-mapped posterior probability for a SNP to be considered part of a Credible Set. For example, PP_threshold=.95 means that all Credible Set SNPs will be 95% Credible Set SNPs.

See also

Other plot: GGBIO.SNP_track(), GGBIO.add_lines(), GGBIO.invisible_legend(), GGBIO.plot(), GGBIO.track_heights_dict(), GGBIO.transcript_model_track()

Examples

data("BST1")
gr.snp <- DT_to_GRanges(dat)
#> Error in dplyr::mutate(subset_DT, SEQnames = paste0("chr", CHR)): object 'dat' not found
## Create fake QTL P-values
gr.snp$fake_eQTL.P <- gr.snp$P  * c(1,.9,.7)
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'gr.snp' not found
qtl.track <- GGBIO.QTL_track(gr.snp=gr.snp, QTL_prefix="fake_eQTL.", labels_subset=c("Lead SNP"), color_r2=F)
#> Error in GGBIO.QTL_track(gr.snp = gr.snp, QTL_prefix = "fake_eQTL.", labels_subset = c("Lead SNP"),     color_r2 = F): object 'gr.snp' not found
